get.description:
A Project resource represents a planned and track-able project within ProjectManager.com.

Use this API to retrieve the details of a single project using its unique identifier.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project you want to fetch.

Result.value:
{
    "status": "Okay",
    "project": {
        "budget": 300000000.00,
        "chargeCode": null,
        "custom1": null,
        "custom2": null,
        "custom3": null,
        "custom4": null,
        "customer": null,
        "description": "",
        "manager": null,
        "priority": {
            "id": 4638,
            "name": "Critical"
        },
        "rate": 200.00,
        "shortName": "Feb-16-",
        "status": {
            "id": 4638,
            "name": "Open"
        },
        "id": 216587,
        "name": "Feb-16-Reg-1",
        "customColumns":
          [
            { name: "MyCurrencyCol", type: "currency", extendedColumnId=567},
            { name: "MyNumberCol", type: "number", extendedColumnId=568},
            { name: "MyDateCol", type: "currency", extendedColumnId=569},
            { name: "MyStringCol", type: "string", extendedColumnId=570},
            { name: "MyBoolCol", type: "bool", extendedColumnId=571}
          ]
    }
}

delete.description:
A Project resource represents a planned and track-able project within ProjectManager.com.

Use this API to set a particular Project to delete/inactive status.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The ID of the project you want to delete.

put.description:
A Project resource represents a planned and track-able project within ProjectManager.com.

Use this API to update a single Project within ProjectManager.com.

shortName.description: Ths shortname of your project. Maximum 7 characters.

description.description: The description of your project. Maximum 1000 characters.

rate.description: Decimal, The project's default rate per hour.

budget.description: Decimal.  The budget for the project.

chargeCode.description: {id: chargeCodeId}. The charge code Id for the project. Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/customFields

status.description: {id: statusId}. The project status Id. Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/statuses

priority.description: {id: priorityId}. The project priority Id. Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/priorities

manager.description: {id: managerId}. The project manager Id for the project. Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/managers

custom1.description: {id: custom1Id}.  Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/customFields

custom2.description: {id: custom2Id}. Retrieve using pproject data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/customFields

custom3.description: {id: custom3Id}.  Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/customFields

custom4.description: {id: custom4Id}. Retrieve using project data endpoint: /api/v1/ProjectData/customFields

get.description:
A Task instance represents a task created within a Project. It may be a high level summary task, or a task within a task.

Use this API to retrieve the full list of Tasks for a given project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The Id of the project to retrieve tasks for.

<?

  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")

$data = file_get_contents('https://api.projectmanager.com/api/v1/projects/1234/tasks.json', false, $context);

post.description:
A Task instance represents a task created within a Project. It may be a high level summary task, or a task within a task. 

Use this API to create a Task against a particular project.

projectId.description: The project your task belongs to.

duration.description: The duration of the task, in minutes.

assignments.description: List<int>, The list of the resource ids to assign to the given task.

customColumns.description: Task-level custom columns and their value. (Note: the column must have been previously created for the project before you can post it here)

get.description:
A Project resource represents a planned and trackable project within ProjectManager.com.

Use this API to retrieve all the projects available to this user, in the order in which they were created. 

There are no filters for this particular call, however you can use [/resources/{resourceId}/assignedProjects](/v1.0/docs/projects-by-resource) API to retrieve the projects assigned to a particular resource.

code-samples.name: jQuery

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://api.projectmanager.com/api/v1/projects.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>
code-samples.name: PHP

post.description:
A Project resource represents a planned and trackable project within ProjectManager.com.

Use this API to create a single project in Project Manager.com. You can specify a minimum of Project Name to create a Project via the API.

shortName.description: Ths shortname of your project, max 7 characters.

description.description: The description of the project, max 1000 characters.

rate.description: Project default rate per hour. Please note that the rate must be non-negative.

budget.description: Budget for project. Please note that the budget must be non-negative.

code-samples.name: jQuery

put.description:
A Resource instance represents a resource created for a particular business account. This may be a resource associated with a particular user, or an inanimate resource.

Use this API to update an existing Resource.

hourRate.description: Decimal. Hourly rate for resource. The hourly rate will not updated if null is passed in to this parameter.

shortName.description: The short name of the resource. Maximum 7 characters. If more than 7 characters is specified we will truncate the value of this field

delete.description:
A Resource instance represents a resource created for a particular business account. This may be a resource associated with a particular user, or an inanimate resource.

Use this  API to delete an existing Resource.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the resource you would like to delete.

get.description:
A Resource instance represents a resource created for a particular business account. This may be a resource associated with a particular user, or an inanimate resource.

Use this API to retrieve a single resource by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The id of the resource you want to retrieve.

get.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities/leave for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task or admin type for a specific date.

Use this API to retrieve a full list of Timesheet entries for a particular task.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The unique Id of the Task that you would like to retrieve timesheets for.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/tasks/[taskId]/timesheets.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

get.description:
A Folder represents a Directory created in ProjectManager.com. This may be a Project folder, or a user created folder.

Use this API to retrieve a user's Folder structure.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/folders.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

delete.description:
A File instance represents a file added or attached in ProjectManager.com. This may be a file attached to a Project or shared documents etc.

Use this API to delete a single file.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The id of the file that you would like to delete.

get.description:
A File instance represents a file added or attached in ProjectManager.com. This may be a file attached to a Project or shared documents etc.

Use this API to fetch a single file by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: fileId
parameters.description: The Id of the file you would like to retrieve.

get.description:
A Project represents a planned and trackable Project within ProjectManager.com.

Use this API to fetch a full list of projects assigned to a particular resource. You can retrieve a list of valid `resourceId` values by calling [https://api.projectmanager.com/api/v1/resources.json](/v1.0/docs/retrieve-resources).

NOTE: The API instructions use the term "Resource" in both the Code and in these Developer instructions to reference Resourceid. However, in the live Product, the term "Resource" has been globally changed to "People" or "Person" to indicate a resource.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The Id of the resource you wish to query assigned projects for.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://api.projectmanager.com/api/v1/resources/1234/assignedProjects.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

delete.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task or admin type for a specific date.

Use this API to delete a Timesheet record by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: timesheetId
parameters.description: The id of the timesheet that you would like to delete.

put.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task or admin type for a specific date.

Use this API to update a Timesheet record by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: timesheetId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Timesheet record that you wish to update.

Hours.description: Hours of the timesheet entry. Will not update if the value is null

name.description: Description of the timesheet entry. Will not update if the name is null.

get.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task or admin type for a specific date.

Use this API to retrieve a single Timesheet by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: timesheetId
parameters.description: The unique Id of the Timesheet entry that you would like to retrieve.

post.description:
A Resource instance represents a resource created for a particular business account. This may be a resource associated with a particular user, or an inanimate resource like a meeting room.

Use this API to create a Resource that can be assigned to Tasks.

shortName.description: The shortname of your resource, max 7 characters
shortName.default: First 7 chars of the name attribute if not provided

hourRate.description: Decimal, resource default rate per hour

get.description:
A Resource instance represents a resource created for a particular business account. This may be a resource associated with a particular user, or an inanimate resource.

Use this API to retrieve all active resources set up against a business account.

NOTE: The API instructions use the term "Resource" in both the Code and in these Developer instructions to reference Resourceid. However, in the live Product, the term "Resource" has been globally changed to "People" or "Person" to indicate a resource.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://api.projectmanager.com/api/v1/resources.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

get.description:
A File instance represents a file added or attached in ProjectManager.com. This may be a file attached to a Project or shared documents etc.

Use this API to retrieve the files within a given folder.

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the folder from which to retrieve files from.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/folder/[id]/files.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

get.description:
A File instance represents a file added or attached in ProjectManager.com. This may be a file attached to a Project or shared documents etc.

Use this API to retrieve the files attached against a particular Timesheet record.

parameters.name: timesheetId
parameters.description: The Id of the timesheet to retrieve attachments for.

get.description:
A File instance represents a file added or attached in ProjectManager.com. This may be a file attached to a Project or shared documents etc.

Use this API to retrieve the files attached against a given task.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The id of the task that you want to retrieve the files for.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/task/[id]/files.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

post.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task or admin type for a specific date.

Use this API to retrieve create a Timesheet record.

resourceId.description: The unique identifier of the resource the timesheet is for.

projectId.description: The id of the project that the time is being recorded against.

taskId.description: The id of the Task that the time is being recorded against. The task must belong to the project  denoted by the project  Id.

adminTypeId.description: Admin Type Id (e.g. Sick leave). If this field is specified, projectId and taskId should be empty.

date.description: The date that the timesheet entry is for.

Hours.description: The number of hours recorded by the timesheet entry.

get.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities/leave for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task or admin type for a specific date.

Use this API to retrieve a list of Timesheet records for a particular Project.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: The Id of the project you wish to retrieve timesheets for.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/projects/[projectId]/timesheets.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

get.description:
A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task(or admin type) for a specific date.

Use this API to retrieve a list of Timesheet records for a particular Resource.

NOTE: The API instructions use the term "Resource" in both the Code and in these Developer instructions to reference Resourceid. However, in the live Product, the term "Resource" has been globally changed to "People" or "Person" to indicate a resource.

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: The Id of the resource you want to retrieve timesheets for.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/resources/[resourceId]/timesheets.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>

post.description: Use this API to upload a file into a Folder, or attach a file against a Task or Timesheet record.

file.description: Files send by multipart/form-data, example below.

folderId.description: The folder your file will upload to.
folderId.default: My Docs if no timesheet or project id provided, otherwise default to project root folder

taskId.description: The task your file will belong to.

timesheetId.description: The timesheet your file will belong to.

get.description:
In ProjectManager.com you can specify a number of customizable fields against projects.

Use this API to fetch a list of all possible values for a given customizable Project field. The API explorer below is set to fetch `statuses` but you can also fetch `priorities`, `managers`, `charge codes` and `custom fields` by changing the endpoint:

- /ProjectData/statuses.json
- /ProjectData/priorities.json
- /ProjectData/managers.json
- /ProjectData/chargecodes.json  (v1 & v2)
- /ProjectData/customFields.json

You can then use those values when you're creating Projects via the Create Project API.

Note: the chargecodes.json endpoint Version 2 is also available.  (api.projectmanager.com/api/v2/ProjectData/chargecodes.json) - Version 2 fixes the json naming conventions in the response.

In ProjectManager.com you can specify a number of timesheet admin types.

Use this API to fetch a list of all possible values for your timesheet admin types.

You can then use those values when you're creating timesheets using the Create Timesheet API or to retrieve all timesheets for a given admin type using the get timesheets by admin type API.

A Timesheet instance records the number of hours spent on Tasks and Administrative activities for a particular Resource.

A Timesheet entry is for a particular day, and there can only be one Timesheet record per Resource for a particular task(or admin type) for a specific date.

Use this API to retrieve a list of Timesheet records for a particular Admin Type.

parameters.name: AdminTypeId
parameters.description: The Id of the admin type you want to retrieve timesheets for.

code-samples.code:
<?
$context = stream_context_create(array(
  'http'=>array(
    'method'=>"GET",
    'header'=>"apiKey: [yourApiKey]")
));
$data = file_get_contents('https://secure.projectmanager.com/api/v1/resources/[AdminTypeId]/timesheets.json', false, $context);
print_r(json_decode($data));
?>
